I know, I know, I have to quit, every day I say this is my last dip. I just need a little push.
I can give you a little push. You're ruining your health and need to quit.
Of course, I want a healthy baby, I just need to get through this pregnancy. My other son is so worried about me chewing. I don't want him to worry.

Your son wouldn't need to worry if you weren't chewing. You need to find ways to quit to protect yourself and your baby, while reducing stress for your young son. He's impressionable and needs to feel safe.
I'm not ready to stop today, but soon. I know I have to stop, everything I read says it is bad. I think about it a lot, I know my husband would be relieved.
Don't quit for your husband. Quit for yourself. You know what to do, so now you just need to follow through.
Maybe if I got a little more exercise it would help me quit.
Exercise is a great stress reducer and increases your energy. You can harness that energy to help you quit.
I know I should quit, I know it's bad for my baby, but everyone I know does it.
You can't base your health decisions on what your friends are doing. You have to take care of yourself and your baby so you can watch them grow up.
I know its bad to have my phone out all the time. I have so many emails coming in. Sometimes I want to space out and check my Instagram.
You're too busy and need to find ways to reduce your responsibilities.
I know its better to wear a helmet, but I really enjoy the freedom of riding without restraints, makes me feel unstoppable.
You're less likely to die if wearing a helmet, but it doesn't reduce your odds completely. You can still feel the freedom of riding while staying safe.

I don't know if I want to vaccinate my child. I want to protect my child against disease but some of my friends think it causes autism. I'm not sure it does but I will regret it if something happened.
It's your job to protect your child and you need to find stand up to your friends who are pushing you to take unnecessary health risks.

I have a hard time checking my blood sugar, so busy with the kids and work, kept thinking about that time I checked my sugar and ended up giving myself too much insulin, don't want end up like my mom.
You'll get sick if you don't have enough insulin. This is something you have to do for yourself. No one else can help you.
I know I am overdue with a colonoscopy, did it when I was 50. I'm 60 now. The prep was horrible. Mine turned out fine and no one in my family has had colon cancer.
You don't know what your cells have been doing the past ten years. It's important to protect your health and learn that everything is OK.
Never had money growing up. Making more now than I never had. Love to treat myself. I pay my credit cards. Yes they are maxed out. I had to take out a loan for my house but that was worth it.
Sounds like you think increasing your debt is more fun than having money long-term, so you'll end up like your family, not having money.
A lot on my plate, work, school, planning a wedding. Things will calm down eventually but I cannot sleep or eat enough now.
You can't wait for things to calm down, or you'll be worse off. Maybe you can put off your wedding until have you graduate
Most of the time I am really good about taking the pill but sometimes it slips my mind. Maybe I should ask my partner to use a condom but that kills the mood.
Getting pregnant will kill the mood too. If you use a condom everytime you can be less stressed about your medication adherence while also reducing your risk for STIs
I am willing to give condoms a try but my partner isn't. He tells me he trusts me so there is no point. Truth is, I don't know how I can tell him that I have been cheating.
You need to protect the health of yourself and those with whom you're having sexual contact with. You can do that by being honest and using condoms.

I drink a bit and smoke a little weed, sure it ain't good for me, but I don't see how I can make it through without it. I am anxious from the nightmares. It's not like I am a drug addict. I'll stop in a few months, after I get settled into being back home.
You're using substances to cope with the transition of being back home. Let's consider what other ways you can manage your stress.

Well, I have just been really busy lately. I have a full-time job, and taking care of my family is my other full-time job. I really have no time for working out and eating healthy. Sometimes grabbing fast food or prepared food at the grocery store is all I have to give me an extra ten minutes of sleep. At one time, I used to eat salad at every meal and I liked that light feeling it gave me, but nowadays it is impossible to try and regulate what I am eating. We generally eat hamburgers and fries from McDonald's. Sometimes my husband grabs a rotisserie chicken from the local grocery store. Really, I am just so tired at night, and I really just don't have the energy to cook a healthy well balanced meal.

You said one of your jobs is taking care of your family, but you're not doing a very good job of that if you're feding them fast food. Getting a fully cooked meal from the grocery store is a much improved alternative to fatty, high sugar, foods.

I realize that I need to exercise, but it is next to impossible. I am uncomfortable going to a gym because I feel so self-conscious in my workout clothes. I would rather stay at home just to avoid feeling embarrassed. The other day, I did poke my head into the gym that is nearby my work, but I felt so self-conscious that I just turned around and left. My doctor said that I had to start exercising, but I still don't feel all that motivated to be that physical. Plus, it is hard to find a good amount of time to exercise b/c you have to change your clothes and then you have to take a shower, wash your hair, re-do it, and well by the time you have done all that, there is not much time before you have to go to sleep. And personally, I just don't have the time or the desire to do all of this.
You won't feel better until you start exercises. Maybe you can incorporate exercise into other activities instead of going to the gym.

We tried to reduce the amount of TV she watches but it didn't go so well. In the morning I need to get dressed, take a shower, make some breakfast and I usually end up letting her watch the Wiggles or Dexter's Laboratory just to give me some free time. In the afternoon I feel it might be easier‚Ä¶since maybe I could get her involved in an art project or playing outside.
You need to make time for yourself as well as providing high quality care for your child.

I tried giving my kids fruit for snack, if they don't have their cookies, they make a huge fuss.They expect sweets after school, and I can't stand the sound of their whining when they don't get what they want. Plus, I kind of like baking homemade treats.
Finding a healthier treat they like. Getting them involved in preparing their snacks. Trying smaller portions of cookies. Reduce the frequency of treats. Prepare to deal with their whining.

I've tried everything to help my child lose weight. I always have carrot sticks available and don't let him eat any fried food. I tell him exactly what he can have and watch what he eats very closely. I also make him exercise every day. I'm constantly on him, and yet he hasn't lost a pound!

You're controlling what he's doing, which could be increasing his stress levels. Increased stress hormones make it more difficult to lose weight because your body wants to store the weight for the impending threat you're stressed about. You need to try meditation to reduce your stress, and your child's.

It's just difficult to change my snacking habits.¬† It's become like a hobby or something, it's what I look forward to when I have a stressful day... But I'm putting on a lot of weight and it seems that all I do for fun is eat.
Sounds like finding other ways to unwind and bring joy to your life might be helpful.
I really want to lose weight, and want to start working out, so this week I decided to go to the gym at 6am before work everyday. But I keep oversleeping.
Sounds like working out in the morning won't work for you. Or you need to reframe your morning mantra so you want to get up earlier.

If I try to quit drinking, I'll have to go live on an island by myself for a month or so. And I can't do that, I have a family. My kids need me. And it's not fair to them that I take out my anger on them. And usually when I try to quit, my husband will hand me a drink after a couple hours and beg me to have some so I shut up.
You need to manage your anger with something that's not alcohol if you want to quit sucessfully.
Yeah since they cut down my juice dose. I've been drinking a little bit, at least it's legal, hell I have two kids and no help. It beats trying to use on top, haven't done that for weeks.
Adding alcohol will only worsen your withdraw and could have additional negative health consequences.

If I want to find a job, I know I can. I got good grades in high school, but right now, I just want to figure out where to live without having to be around these smack heads, being around them is bad for me.
You need to find a different place to live that's clean and safe. You can't stay sober where you are now. Finding a job will help you qualify for better housing.

I really want to lose weight, so this week I decided to be really good and tried to cut out all sweets from my diet. However, I felt miserable by the end of the day and finally broke down and ate a whole box of chocolates.
Maybe cutting sugar cold turkey was too hard on your mental and physical health. You could consider moderating your intake while also avoiding binges.

My problem is food at work. They give us free snacks all day, usually sweets and chips. You know junk and no matter how much I try to avoid going into the lounge, I usually give in and sneak a handful of this or that. If they had something healthier maybe I would grab that instead.

You need to find ways to avoid going to the longue. Maybe tell your coworkers that you don't want to snack on unhealthy foods and see if anyone change what they bring in. You could start a new office policy about not bringing in sweets.

Diets don't work for me. I've tried them all. I lose 10 then gain back 11. Initially I feel great, then I end up feeling deprived and in the back of my mind I know I need to change how I eat and even my relationship with food. I have to stop eating fast food and all that dashboard dining. I actually like cooking but I just don't make the effort to do it. It used to be fun, now it seems like chore who has 2 hours to cook such a fancy meal.
Maybe you can find recipes that take less than 20mins to prepare and cook. You don't have to go all or nothing.

I've tried to stop eating so many sweets and desserts. I love candy, ice cream, cake and anything with sugar. It tastes so good and makes me feel happy. I know it's not good for me, and diabetes runs in our family but I have a serious sweet tooth.
Your sweet tooth has grown because you've been feeding it. You need to cut out sugar for at least 30 days to see how your taste buds change.

I used to be really active. Played tennis in a league, biked, hiked, but somehow life and middle age got in the way. And now I do nothing. It feels weird starting it up again, what if I am no good at it, I used to be so good. I was an A grade player, I am going to feel like I suck, and I dread feeling winded and out of shape. I will probably be sore too the next day, it just seems so foreign to me now.
You might feel sore at first. You won't notice once you're back in shape. Maybe you can try one of the activit√©s you remember enjoying or start with a solo activity like running.

My brother lost 10lbs the first week and 2lbs every week for a few months. Me, I'm lucky to lose a pound. I must be doing something wrong. He always beats me at EVERYTHING. At this rate I am never going to lose the 50lbs.. I don't think I can do this.
Every body is different and several factors go into weight loss.

Sure, I would feed them better . I know all this junk food is bad. But it cost so much to buy healthy food. Have you seen the price of fresh fruits and vegetables lately. And, fish, forget about it. I can afford chicken, but they get bored with the same old thing. And frozen vegetables have all that salt and MSG in it.
If you want to feed them better, like you say, you must eliminate the junk from your life.
Do you have diabetes ? Do you have any idea how hard it is to live with this?
Many people lead successful lives while maintaining healthy blood sugar levels. You need to make your health a priority.
Have you ever tried to get off coke ? Do you have any idea how hard it is to quit this stuff?
You need to focus on sobriety and finding people that want to live clean and healthy. You need to surround yourself with others who want what's best for you.
So, were you ever heavy, how can you really relate to me?
I know how to help you lose weight. You have to be willing to do the work to change your unhealthy habits.
Have you ever smoked ? Do you have any idea how hard it is to quit
You're losing your resolve to quit. You must refocus on your reasons for wanting to quit.
So, have you ever had breast cancer or any cancer for that matter, do you know what it's like to have your body turn on you like this?
No one can truly understand your experiences but I can understand why it's hard for you. You are strong and will get through this.
I don't want to come back. I am so scared of having Cancer, my mom died of it.
Avoiding diagnosis and treatment can only cause more severe problems. Early intervention is your best chance.
So do you have MS, do you know what it's like to have to inject yourself everyday, to live with such uncertainty.
You have a treatment course you can focus on. You have to take care of yourself or your symptoms will worsen.
I don't eat any lunchmeat anymore, bread hardly ever, I don't hardly use salt anymore
You've given up a lot of unhealthy things. Let's look at your food log to see how well you've replaced the higher sodium foods.
Well, I read canned vegetables are better than the fresh stuff.
Unfortunately canned foods contain higher amounts of sodium than fresh foods. You should avoid canned foods, even vegetables when you can.
I can do that when I'm at the store.
You need to set a reminder in your phone and add it to your shipping list.
I'd like to eat less processed foods, but I guess I'm not sure what those are.
Well processed foods are everywhere. You need to read labels and monitor what you're eating.
I like going to the gym, I like exercising; I exercise a couple hours a week. But I'm not sure what to do when the gym is closed.
You can do a modified version of those things outside or even from home. Let's look at the exercises you're doing at the gym and make a plan.

I know I am too big, and I probably should exercise more and eat better, but I am so busy. I've got school, homework, and my job at the mall, so I don't see anywhere to fit it in. Plus, I can't afford any of those gyms. And none of my friends want to exercise with me. They're lazier than I am.
Do you have a cheap gym near you, like a Planet Fitness?

I don't trust doctors. I don't trust the CDC. God gave us an immune system and as a healthy persons that is all I need to protect myself from getting COVID. I think this is all a bunch of hysteria and profiteering by the Pharm industry
Do you think everyone in healthcare is in it for the money?
Doctor x, I don't want the Covid vaccine for me or my kids. They don't know enough about how safe it is and what long term side effects it causes. It is not for me or my family.
Don't you know the long-term side effects of getting. COVID-19?

I know I should probably get the vaccine. I have my mother living with me and she has type-2 diabetes. I would hate to bring it home to her. But I just don't know about those side effects. I heard it changes your DNA and the vaccine can give you the virus.
Do you believe the side effects of the vaccine are worse for you than if you got COVID-19?

I know because I am so heavy and have diabetes I probably should exercise more, but I am so busy. With the three kids and my new job I don't see anywhere to fit it in. Plus, I hate the gym. I can't stand being around all that Lycra. My husband is useless because he already plays basketball four times a week.
Can you play basketball with your husband?

Of course, I would like to lose weight and not feel gross all the time. But I hate all the diets my mom puts me on. I've tried them all. Every time I end up feeling deprived and hungry. Then I gain all the weight back. I'm getting ready to give up.
Can you find a diet that your mom hasn't recommended?
Of course I would like to lose weight. But I hate diets. I've tried them all. Every time I end up feeling deprived and hungry. Then I gain all the weight back. I'm getting ready to give up.
Don't you know how bad yo-yo dieting is for you?

We eat at Wendy's a few times a week. It's cheap, fast, my kids like it, and it's better than those other places. There's a lot worse we could be eating. Sure, there are better foods than that, but I don't have time to cook.
Why do you think that Wendy's is better than other fast food places?
I really need to find someone to exercise with. I can't do it alone. I just need someone to remind me or do it with me, but there is no one.
Why don't you exercise with your husband?
Look at you, were you ever heavy? How can you really relate to me?
Why does that matter?

I know I need to eat better. But I live alone, I'm a lousy cook, and I have no time or interest to learn how. Sure, McDonalds is poison but it's fast and cheap and I'm not embarrassed to eat there alone.
You're embarrassed to eat alone?
Yes, I know all that TV and all those video games are not good for her. By what can I do? I cannot afford a babysitter and I must get my work done. I work out of my home.
You know that screentime is horrible for them but you still let them watch tv and play video games all night?

I really need to start exercising, but I hate the GYM. I joined the one nearby my house, but I never go. Everyone is so young and skinny; I hate those young girls in their little outfits. There is no way I would go there again, it was horrible.
Why do you care what everyone else looks like?
I need to quit these damn cigarettes already. But I am so scared of the withdrawal, I am at a loss for what to do.
Have you thought about using meds to help with withdrawl symptoms?
I have tried every diet under the sun. To be honest Doc, I would love to lose weight but at this point I don't think I can do it. Maybe I need one of those stomach staples.
Have you tried counting calories and weighing your food?

I have no energy. The thought of working out now is out of the question. I used to bike and play tennis but that seems a lifetime ago. I would love to feel alive again, but I am just so tired all the time.
Why do you think all exercise is draining? What about walking?
I've tried the Atkins diet and I lost a lot of weight. Then gained it all back. Then I tried the Zone diet but felt really hungry all the time. I just don't know what to do. I'm at my wit's end.
Do you think you're actually ready to change?
I just hate to exercise. Was never good at sports in school. I know I need to lose weight, but I am not going to the gym. It just isn't going to happen.
Why are you focused on exercise instead of what you eat?
I start a diet every day but once I get hungry, I lose my discipline.
Why can't you stick to your goals?
Of course, I would like to lose weight. But I hate diets. I've tried them all. Each time I feel deprived and feel hungry. Then I start to feel resentful.
Are you sure you stick to the diet?
I've done everything I'm supposed to do in this program, but it still hasn't worked. I'm still gaining weight. I haven't lost a damn pound in months.
Are you sure you're following the program correctly?
I would do about anything to lose these 50lbs. But dieting doesn't work for me. Could you tell me what drugs or even surgery might help?
Are you sure you've given up all unhealthy food?
I like fruit but I like sweets more. If it's around I eat it but not if there is cake or cookies or ice cream. I guess I need to stop buying that crap.
Why do you keep buying sweets?
I only eat a few vegetables. Corn, raw carrots, peas, and potatoes. Not much into those slimy ones like okra, cooked peppers, and onions. Ugh! They have to be crunchy, or I get grossed out.
Have you tried other vegetables?
My wife does most of the cooking. But I do the shopping. If I buy vegetables, she will cook them.
Why don't you just buy more vegetables then?
I buy fruit. But it sits in the bowl and rots. I hate having to throw out that rotten, mushy mess. It's such a waste.
Why don't you buy canned instead?
I'm on a tight budget and fresh fruit just costs so much. Vegetables are a little less expensive, but you have to cook them. Fruit you can just eat.
Can't you cut out some of the sweets you buy to pay for the fruit?
I live alone and don't cook much. Veggies take so much time and effort to prepare. So, when I go out to eat, which is 4-5 times a week, I try to order veggies.
Can't you just eat raw vegetables at home?
My child cannot participate in the program because I work two jobs, my other kids are struggling in school. We are just too busy.
Don't you care about their health?
We have done everything that we are supposed to do in this program, but it still hasn't worked. My daughter is still gaining weight.
Are you sure you've done everything you can? Has she given up all sugar sweetened beverages?
Why bother? The other family in our house won't put a TV timer on their TV and our kids just go to the living room to watch with them.
Have you tried telling your kids not to go into the living room?
The food at school breakfast and lunch are all red lights, so it is hard for her to follow the diet.
What if you packed her a lunch?
My husband won't support the program, he wants whole milk because it is healthier and tastes better and wants our son to have it so he grows to be strong.
Why can't you just buy what's healthier?

Every time I bring up my daughter's weight with her, it leads to a fight. She tells me to get off her case. Then my husband tells me to back off and let her be. ‚ÄúShe'll grow out of it‚Äù, he says. But I think it's important to do something about it now, before it's too late.
What happens if you talk to her about her nutrition, or what she eats?

It breaks my heart to see her so heavy. I know what it's like to be a big teenager. It was terrible for me. I want to bring it up but I don't want to hurt her feelings. I tell her that she looks fine, but at the same time I know she is way too big for her age.
Don't you wish someone had talked to you about your weight when you were a teen?

I can't stand how much TV she watches. When I leave for work, she is watching talk shows. When she comes home from school more talk shows. I think she is frying her brain and wasting her talent. I don't know what to do about it. I wish I could get her to be more active or to be involved in something more positive.
Can't you just control her internet/cable access?

My son's problem is sweets. He loves candy, cake and ice cream. He won't eat any regular food and I feel so bad that he is hungry that I usually give in and let him have junk food, just so he gets something into his system.
Why do you keep buying unhealthy food?

There is no way that I can let my son leave food on his plate and throw food out. I wasn't raised that way. I also don't think kids need choice about how much they eat, kids are given too much power in my opinion already. I am tired of the constant battle we have at mealtimes and all the tricks we need to pull off to get him to eat something, but letting him leave the table hungry, and taking away French fries and HI-c are going to be very stressful.
Why not just only offer healthy foods?

I eat at Wendy's a few times a week. It's cheap, it's fast, and it's better than those other places. There's a lot worse I could be eating. My parents don't buy healthy foods, and I don't have the money to buy them.
Why are you still getting fast food?
I am so tired of my parents bugging me about my weight. They always comment on everything I eat. It is so annoying. I will deal with this my way.
What are your parents saying that you don't agree with?
Vaping isn't nearly as bad as cigarettes. It doesn't cause cancer. Everyone does it. It's no big deal.
Don't you know how bad it is for you?
Chewing is so much better than cigarettes. You can do it while you work. I know it isn't great for me, but I need the little buzz to keep me alert.
Do you coworkers know you're chewing?

I am just not going to give up my iqmik. I already gave up cigarettes and alcohol. We make it ourselves and we know what goes into it. Everyone wants to take away everything that helps me cope with my stress. And sweetie I got lots of stress.
If you gave up alcohol and cigarettes, why is it so hard to give this up too?

Of course, I have to quit at some point, but now is just not the time. I know what it's like to go through the withdrawal and it's pretty awful. I was able to quit a few years ago, with the help of that gum, but with my wife losing her job and having to work so much overtime, I don't think I have the energy to deal with it right now.
How can you afford it with your wife not working?
Why should I quit? I am in good shape. I play soccer. I am thin. My father smoked until he was 80. Most of my mates smoke and no one has died from it. I don't believe its as bad as you all say.
You really don't think smoking is bad for you?
Maybe it's time to quit. I am 55, my dad died of heart disease, and I am coughing up all this junk every morning.
Your dad died of heart disease and you still smoke?

I don't know why people who never smoked keep bugging me to quit. My doctor has no idea how hard it is to even try quitting. I've tried to quit many times but can't even go two days. No one knows how hard it is to give it up out of the blue.
Why can't you make a plan to quit over a few months?

I am still working, as I am the sole bread winner in the family ‚Äì my husband is unemployed. We have another child who is a toddler, and things are hard financially. And sometimes, I get very angry and upset so smoking helps me calm down. I sometimes feel it is all I have left.
When will you husband get a job so he can start helping you out?

I know that 2 cigarettes per day are not a problem to the health of the baby. I know that I cannot give them up completely (it would be stressful), so as long as I stay at 2 per day, it should be fine.
You think it's ok to smoke while pregnant?
I smoked throughout my previous pregnancy, and it was fine ‚Äì both me and the baby were fine. I don't feel it is a problem I should focus on.
Do you know the long-term impacts your child may experience from having a mom who smokes?
I don't have what it takes to stop smoking. I am not ambitious enough. I am not tough enough to beat this.
Have you thought about joining a support group for people trying to quit?

We didn't plan for this pregnancy, it was all unexpected. And I have been feeling fine, no morning sickness, no nothing. It feels like nothing changed in my life, except for this belly which keeps growing. So, I don't feel I should change anything about my life. That's why I don't feel I need to stop smoking.
What do your pregnant friends say?
I cannot stop thinking about how I am hurting my baby by continuing smoking. But I cannot stop. And the more I think about it, the more I smoke and feel bad about it.
Isn't your baby worth it to quit?

No one can tell me what to do. If I want to smoke, I will and I will stop when I feel like it. I have reduced the number of cigarettes anyway, so I don't smoke that much anymore, but if anyone tells me to quit, I feel like I want to light up a cigarette right then.
Can't you just tell yourself to quit?

I think that it may become difficult to stay smoke free once I return to work. There is a ritual in the office, it's how we start the days and take breaks. I could not guarantee that once I return to work and the baby is all grown up I won't start again. But definitely not now, while I am breastfeeding and around the little one all day.
If you can not smoke at home, what's the big deal about also not smoking at work?

I was never a real smoker, you know? Just when I was having a hard time at work or when stress gets really bad, but it doesn't happen often enough for me to call myself a smoker. It's not like I ever had a pack a day. Even if I start again, it won't be more than a few a day.
Will you sign this contract stating you'll never smoke a cigarette again?

The biggest challenge is having friends over and seeing them smoke. I used to smoke with my (female) friends and just gossip and catch up. And I don't miss smoking per se, but when they come to visit me, especially now when the child is small and everyone comes to see him, it's sometimes hard to see everyone smoking.
Where can you make new friends?

My husband still smokes. But he only smokes on the balcony, so not around me, although he did smoke next to me when we went out last time. Then it wasn't a temptation, because my reasons for quitting are strong, but I guess that could be a temptation to start smoking again in the future.
Have you told your husband to quit?
I tried to stop smoking but it is very difficult when I go to work, as all my colleagues smoke during our breaks. It is hard to say no when everyone around you is smoking.
Have you thought about getting a different job or people don't smoke?

I know that smoking is harmful, but I don't see myself being affected by it. I read the warnings on the cigarette packs, and I even looked for information online. So, I know what it does. But I don't feel it will happen to me.
Have you ever heard of black lung?

At this point I am smoke free. I decided to do this while I'm breastfeeding. However, I will probably start smoking after breastfeeding ends. I am a physician and I know that five cigarettes a day won't kill me.
Why would you quit during breastfeeding just to go back to smoking?

I feel very agitated when I try to quit smoking. Also, the doctor told me, if things get rough, instead of being depressive or anxious, I can light up a cigarette, have three puffs and then discard it. So, I have reduced smoking, but I cannot quit completely. I sometimes still smoke a quarter of a cigarette to keep myself calm.
A doctor told you it's ok to smoke??
Since I quit smoking I never thought about it. I am only thinking about it now, that you brought it up.
Really? You never think about it?

I don't consider myself as someone who has quit smoking. I don't say that to people because very often people's response to that is ‚ÄúEveryone starts smoking again eventually! It's like they want to warn you not to get ahead of yourself. So, I just get discouraged and I would rather not say that or talk about smoking with the others, although I guess that I am no longer a smoker since I have stopped smoking for some time now.
Aren't you worried you're going to start smoking again?

My husband supports me. He actually forbids me to smoke. I don't necessarily like this, you can imagine. Sometimes it actually makes me want to smoke more, but I still don't do it, because I am doing this for the baby's health. But it's really unpleasant when we talk about it. He still smoking of course.
How can your husband say he supports you if he's still smoking?

My reasons (to quit) have very much to do with the baby's health. I could not imagine smoking after we found out I was pregnant and I think my husband felt the same. And now we are so happy and I breastfeed, so I could not intoxicate him or smell like cigarettes around him, you know how hands smell when you smoke‚Ä¶ But after I no longer breastfeed and he is grown up, I really couldn't say, if we want us to be honest here. It's too hard to imagine what may happen in 2-3 years or more.
Do you want to smoke around your child?
My husband does not like how my mouth smells, after smoking. He is glad that I stopped smoking, so this will help me in the future to stay smoke free.
Is fresh breath important to you too?
Now that I have stopped smoking, I will never smoke again. I know myself and once I decide something, I never turn back.
What do you know about yourself?

I tried to quit smoking several times, however, each time I started smoking again. But after I found out I was pregnant, I never thought of smoking again. The baby is the greatest motivation. There are no temptations to smoke. Now I am focusing on raising the baby. The baby is my life. That should keep me from smoking.
What are some better reasons besides the baby to quit?

After becoming pregnant, something changed in my body and my body rejected cigarettes. I was feeling sick when I smoked and even just from smelling the smoke. Now I can't believe how foolish I was to ever smoke.
Why couldn't you find this motivation without getting knocked up?

There is no need for you (counselor) and I to discuss how my wife can remain smoke free. If a person wants to do something, they will just do it. If she wants to smoke, she will smoke, it is not something that we can influence.
How can you possibly support her continuing to smoke?

I quit when my wife decided to quit, because I do not think that such a change can happen unless both partners work together. But she has been through so much stress because of the baby's health problems that I sometimes worry she will start smoking just because of all that stress and pressure.
Why does what she decides about smoking impact you?

I'm happy she quit, but I do not think I would fight with her or even say something if she started smoking again, we do not have that kind of relationship. I respect her and I would eventually accept this, especially because I know she would not smoke around the child or while breastfeeding.
You don't care if she starts smoking again? What kind of husband says that?

I don't want to help my wife to stay smoke free. It's her job, not mine, her decision, not mine. I can't force her or convince her to stop smoking. She can do whatever she wants with her life now that the baby has come.
Can you send her text message reminders to not smoke around the baby?
Is not up for discussion if she starts smoking or not. She won't. I won't allow her that.
What can you do to make sure she doesn't smoke?
What? She told you she did not smoke for several months? She just smoked yesterday. She won't stop smoking.
How can you make sure she doesn't keep lying?
I will stay smoke free during the breastfeeding period, however, I am not determined to stay smoke free after. I am not sure what will happen but I don't want to think about that.
Why can't you just stay quit?
This is not the time for me to talk about smoking. The baby takes all my energy and I don't have energy to even think about smoking.
When can we talk about it then?
Sometimes I feel like not knowing if I will get Huntington's disease might be better than knowing. What's the point of knowing if there is no cure.
Who taught you it's better not to know?
I know I need annual mammograms, but I cannot deal with that now. I have too much going on with my divorce and my mother being ill.
Don't you care about your health?
I know my son might have FAP, but I can't take him to have that colonoscopy that is out of the question.
Don't you care if your son has FAP?
I am scared to tell my daughters I have the BRCA mutation, I don't know how to explain it to them without freaking them about.
Don't you want them to be tested too?
I worry that I'm being too hasty in my decision to end this pregnancy. Maybe I should wait and think it over
You're considering abortion??

We are so mixed up right now about whether we should continue the pregnancy. We should be able to make this decision but it is so hard. I am a Christian and I am not sure what scripture has to say about this.
Can't you just ask someone at church?
We had agreed that we would continue the pregnancy no matter what. Now my husband feels differently, but I don't.
Why does what he think matter?
This whole decision would be easier if you would just tell us what to do.
What do you want to know?
I've had other friends who also had an abnormal AFP test and their babies were fine. It makes me less certain I need the amniocentesis.
Why would you not get one?
I just keep thinking about what people in my church would think of me if they ever found out about me ending a pregnancy.
Do you think you could hide an abortion?
We've already had so many tests done to figure out why Jonnie has his problems. I'm not sure if doing this new test (whole genome sequencing) is just another waste of time and money.
Doesn't a parent do everything they possibly can for their child?
Now that I know about my risk for having a child with Duchenne muscular dystrophy, I'm not sure when or if I should tell my boyfriend.
What if you don't tell your boyfriend?
I am so busy getting oriented to college life, I'm not sure where genetic testing fits in.
Will you have time between semesters?
I have already figured out what I'm going to do with my career, and now is clearly the best time for me to have genetic testing to determine my carrier status for cystic fibrosis.
Does next Thursday work?
I love my brother so much, I feel guilty about wanting to know my carrier status for his disease.
Why would you feel guilty for wanting to know about your own health?
Parent of 1 year old with achondroplasia: I don't see why we need to go to neurology, he has the disease and nothing's going to change that.
What's the big deal about going to the neurologist?
I'd rather keep undergoing yearly colonoscopies than have my insurance company know my genetic status for Lynch syndrome.
Why not just tell your insurance company?
Parent of a child potentially eligible for a clinical trial for Duchenne: I don't see why I need to test him. His older brother is doing great and he hates having his blood drawn.
Can you bribe him for the blood draw?
She's only 16, I don't know why she needs to know she has Turner syndrome. She's only going to get upset.
Are you just scared to tell her?
I don't see why I have to talk to you, I told my doctor I wanted the BRCA test and that's all I need.
What's the big deal about talking abou it first?
I don't want to stir up trouble by telling my siblings about my diagnosis of familial adenomatous polyposis.
Don't you feel obligated to tell them?
My sister says it's silly to worry about a couple ultrasound glitches.
Why would you listen to your sister over a doctor?
I don't have to worry, the breast cancer is on my Dad's side.
Did you know you can also inherit breast cancer from your dad's side?
The baby has Down syndrome because I drank during the pregnancy.
Do you know what causes Down Syndrome?
No one else in the family has had cystic fibrosis, so this can't be genetic.
How do you think people get cystic fibrosis then?
Only the men in my family have had colon cancer, so I'm not worried about my MSH2 mutation.
Why do you think colon cancer only impacts men?
I know you think I'm a fool to continue this pregnancy.
Why are you worried about what I think?
I've gone this long with normal colonoscopies, I don't think I need anymore. Everyone in my family had their cancer before 45 and I'm 46.
Did you know that your risk increases with age?
I want every test there is to make sure the baby is perfect.
Does tomorrow work?
The doctor told me there is a 1 in 4 chance of cystic fibrosis. I already have one affected child and I'm not having more than four total children, so my risk is done.
Do you understand statistics?
I know I have NF and don't want to know any more. I'm only here because my mother made me come.
Isn't it better to know?
I know he has Down syndrome, but I know he'll catch up if we just work with him.
Do you understand his diagnosis?
Parent of an 18 month old with diagnosis of Down syndrome. ‚ÄúI just want a referral to a physical therapist so that I can fix the problem.
Do you think you can fix his Down Syndrome?
My mother died of breast cancer, so I know I'm going to die of it too.
Are you giving up?
Everyone has some abnormal genes, I'm probably not at any more risk than anyone else.
You think everyone has some abnormal genes?

I get so sick of trying to get my meds. I go to the pharmacy and they say I can't get them because I am over my 6 limit but to come back. Then I go back and then I have to wait and wait. Then the next week it's the same thing. It's ridiculous, if he wants me to take them then he better make sure that I can get them. Besides, I heard that it's ok if you miss your meds sometimes, that your body stores them up for you.‚Äù
You think your body stores your meds?

These meds aren't helping me. I don't feel any different. I thought these were supposed to help me feel better. I try to remember to take them everyday, but I don't feel them working. What's the point in swallowing those pills if they don't work?
Are you taking them as prescribed?
I stopped using that Advair, ( or other controller medication) it tastes bad and leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
Can't you chew gum after taking it?

I stopped using that Advair, ( or other controller medication) it tastes bad and leaves a bad taste in my mouth, besides I got that other puffer, I heard that you can take that one as much as want, right?
You think you can take the rescue inhaler as much as you want?

Look, I have a bad back and Tylenol don't help. I don't know why my PCP won't keep prescribing me the Oxy. He doesn't understand my pain. I would like to see him deal with this pain all of the time. So I go to the ER to get what I need. Yeah, sometimes I have to go to different ERs to get pain pills ‚Äì so what?
Do you know Oxy dependence can lead to addiction?

The damn pharmacists won't fill my vicodin because I am on Suboxone. Who is she to question what the doctor prescribes. I am not an addict, you know. I have never bought any of these pills on the street. I don't have a problem except I am in pain and tylenol just doesn't cut it.
Do you really need vicodin?

I go to the emergency room because the doctor refuses to give me more Dilaudid. She prescribes it only twice a day and it's not helping me. She is telling me to drink 6-8 glasses of water every day as if that'll take away the pain in my back and lower legs. He doesn't know what people with Sickle go through. I need relief.
Did you try drinking the water?
I try to see my PCP, I call and call and call. I leave messages and they don't get back to me. That's why I go to the emergency room, at least I know that they care how I feel.
Have you tried emailing?
I never thought I would get cancer. My family gets heart attacks, diabetes, emphysema‚Ä¶but not cancer. I can't believe this is happening to me. It's a nightmare.
Are you sure no one in your family has had cancer?
What's the point of getting screened. If it's your time, it's your time. When God wants to call you, he calls you.
Why are you so sure there's a God?
It sounds weird but my husband thinks he can ‚Äúcatch‚Äù my cancer if we sleep together. He's such a superstitious fool.
And you still love him?
I watch what I eat, never eat sugar, watch my carbs. I don't understand why my values are so high. I'm bummed, all that effort and look what I have to show for it.
Have you really given up all sugar?
Dialysis terrifies me. I cannot deal with the needles, the blood, the constant worrying about my fluid intake. I always hoped I could control this without dialysis.
DId you think about this years ago when you might have been able to change the outcome?
I am scared to death of starting insulin. I cannot deal with the needles, the blood, the constant worrying about my sugar. I always hoped I could control this without insulin
What's the big deal about needles?
I simply forget. It's not that I don't want to take my metformin, it just slips my mind in the morning when I am in a rush.
Have you tried leaving notes or setting alarms?

I get tired of checking my sugars all the time, makes my fingers too sore. I know that I should but it hurts too much. My neighbor told me that she only checks her sugar every Monday and that tells her how she should eat for the whole week, is that true?
Do you believe everything your neighbor tells you?
Shoot, my LDL is 150‚Ä¶.no way‚Ä¶I take those pills every day‚Ä¶.maybe I have gained some weight lately but come on !
Do you really take your pills every day?

I know I need to lose weight. I have high blood pressure and diabetes, but I just can't seem to get started. Every day I say to myself, 'tomorrow I'll start a diet'. But somehow I never quite get going.
Have you tried counting calories?

I tried cutting back on salt, everything tasted nasty, you ever tried eating without salt? You can't do it, so I just use that Grill Masters stuff, it's not like that regular table salt that you can't eat, right? My wife says to use that instead.
Do you know how much salt is in Grill Masters?
No, I don't use table salt. I use Tony Chacherie's, that's a lot better than salt, don't you think so?
Who told you Tony Chacherie was better for you?
Well, how am I supposed to cook red beans and rice if I can't use sausage because of salt?
Have you tried red beans and rice without sausage?
Oh Honey, I don't drink water at all! My son tells me that Gatorade and PowerAde are a lot better for me, he gets me the kind without the sugar.
Why would you think Gatorade is better than water?
Sometimes I get so angry at her I just hit out. She doesn't push back so it never gets serious. I'm lucky I guess. She knows she's in the wrong.
Who taught you it's ok to hit a woman?
I saw another text on my boyfriend's phone from his ex. That b***ch‚Ä¶. I know she still wants to hook up with him. So things got heated. He promised me he cut her off. Liar.
Why do you think he would cheat?
I never get into fights at school. I know better. They will expel me again. But after school there have been times I have got into it with this girl I hate.
Why would you think fighting would fix anything?

This girl was running her mouth, saying all these things about me that weren't true. I had to shut her up or everyone would think they could talk trash about me. You have to make sure people know she is full of s**t.
Why give her a second thought?

I don't fight anymore. I've grown up. It's not worth it to me anymore, I'm trying to go to college. I'm tired of getting into trouble. Today though, this idiot was running his mouth about my sister and I couldn't stop myself. I had to step up. It was stupid, but she is my sister. He called her the ‚Äúh‚Äù word.
Have you grown up or not?

You have to carry a knife or some protection when you live in a neighborhood like mine. What if sh*t starts to go down. I don't want to be the one without something. The part of Flint where I hang ain't Ann Arbor.
Do you always feel in danger?
I can't believe that I'm the one in here. I'm not the bully. Not like my other friends, they're rough; they're much worse than me. This isn't fair. I just like to make jokes. I am a comedian.
Isn't making jokes at someone's expense what a bully is?

Other kids think I'm tough. They won't mess with me either. Dad said not to put up with any s**t and stand up for yourself. He knows what he's talking about. Nobody would ever mess with me. I would whoop their a**.
Can you think of something else to do besides fighting?
I don't do it all the time, I only do it when she makes me mad when, like when she shows off to other boys. Then I have to put the Sheila in her place.
Have you tried taking a weight lifting class instead?

These things happened to me for all of year six and seven and no-one did anything. How come now I'm getting into trouble now for doing the same thing they did to me? Because I'm new here, I'm just showing them they can't mess with me. Once everyone knows I'm not a loser I'll be right. It ain't fair. Nobody helped me out in my old school.
Didn't you tell a teacher?

What do you mean I'm responsible? I don't get that it's my fault that other people forwarded the photo. I did it to be funny. She shouldn't have had so much to drink and passed out at the party anyway. She was asking for it. I didn't forward to everyone, just David and maybe one other guy. Plus, she is always showing off her body anyway. She is an exhibitionist. It is David's fault.
You thought that was a good idea?

I took the photo and posted on the blog, everyone made comments about how weird she looked. That hairdo was crazy; and those shorts. That's not bullying when everyone else makes the comments right? It was meant to be funny. She didn't get it, it was funny. It's not my fault she took it so personally. I didn't know that she would get so upset. Why is everyone so sensitive all the time.
How would you like it if someone did that to you?
What's the big deal? If I'm such a bully why do I have lots of friends? Nobody likes him. They are happy I put him in his place.
Who was happy you put him in his place?
I only sent it once. I know I shouldn't have sent it but it's not like I'm bashing him up. He chose to be gay. People should know. That isn't my problem. It's his.
What do you have against gay people?

He knows that's where we sit at lunch time. If he walks through he knows that I'm going to get him. He can walk around us. I don't mean to really hurt him. I don't know what else to do, he really annoys me. I just have anger issues. And he pisses me off.
Have you taken anger management classes before?
I just say what everyone else is thinking. There's nothing wrong with it. Everyone else does it. No one has died from it. It's just fun.
Have you always used such extreminst language?
Sure, iqmik probably isn't good for me but it's better than inhaling all that smoke and nasty stuff.
Do you really think it's better for you than smoking?
I switched from cigarettes to iqmik to protect my baby, now you are telling me it is still bad. It's the lessor of two evils if you ask me.
You think it's ok for your baby if you use iqmik?
At least iqmik doesn't stink like cigarettes.
You think that's the worst part?
People don't judge you for iqmik like they do for smoking. Plus, I can hide it from people and they don't even know.
You hide it?
In our culture tobacco can be healthy. It helps cope with stress and is so much better than alcohol.

I switched from smoking tobacco to chewing it because it is better for you.
Do you know the risks of chewing?

Does learning that make you want to quit?
I am under a lot of stress. The chew helps me get through the day. I am raising three kids and now have another on the way. How am I going to pay for all of this. My husband lost his job last year.

Our chew is more natural than that stuff you buy in the store. At least I know where it comes from. No artificial chemicals.

I was told by grandmother that tobacco helps the pregnancy, get you through the rough patches.

I guess if I knew it was bad for my baby then maybe I would consider quitting, but what else can I do about all the stress.

I heard it may be addictive, that worries me. But then that means I may have withdrawal symptoms when I quit. Damned if you do and damned if you don't.

I heard the blended, ground up bull is the worst, most addictive. I stay away from that.
Can you just quit using it all together?
I iqmik before I have to do something creative, helps me focus.
Can't you just elimate distractions to stay on task?

I heard that if you eat grapefruit after a meal it burns the fat off in your stomach.

I heard that you have to eliminate all carbs in order to lose weight. That would be great if it weren't true.
Have you tried starting by giving up bread?
I heard from my friend that you can get the COVID from the vaccine.

Since starting this diuretic medication I am peeing all the time. I'm worried something's wrong. Is this normal?
Didn't you know that?

I am getting worried that I have not lost any weight in the past two months. I'm wondering if maybe my metabolism has slowed. I'm happy I lost the 15 pounds but now it seems that I can't lose anymore. I am eating really healthy and exercising.

You have to put solids in her bottle right away so she can sleep better.

I'd always had a lot of energy, but now with this heart failure thing I can't do anything. I tried to go Christmas shopping, but by the time I'd gone about a block, I was so tired that my husband took me home and I went back to bed.
Could you think of anything to cut from your schedule?

I put off household tasks to conserve energy. Our house has two levels, so if anyone came over, they would have to go upstairs for me to get my things, and that felt terrible. Eventually, I got so bad I couldn't walk across the room without being out of breath. I spent a lot of time in denial over being in heart failure. I have to rest more often than I like and can't stay up as long as I like.
Could you have someone clean for you?
Every morning I go to the scale and think what's it going to be today? Up 2 lbs, up 4? Am I holding water again. Some days I have to wear sweatpants because I feel so bloated and uncomfortable.
How many milligrams of sodium have you been consuming everyday?
I also have ‚Äúpins and needles‚Äù in one foot and it's very annoying. I'm wondering if I will have it from now on ‚Äì I find that it's better if I move regularly, but it still drives me crazy.
What kinds of physical activities do you want to add to your day?

I'm having a real problem with dizziness. Sometimes I know it's from standing up quickly‚Ä¶.so I have to sit down or I can be walking down the hallway and have to suddenly grab the wall for support. I don't really trust myself to go up the stairs ‚Äì I'm too afraid of falling.
Do you have a room to move everything to one level of your house?
Since heart failure hammered me in 1994, I had never managed to sustain a regular exercise routine. I know I need to do it but I cannot get any regular routine established.
What have you tried to incorporate into your regular routine?
It really scares me when I have to drive somewhere; I always have to give myself lots of extra time, and even then I am so worried about hurting myself or someone else if I get into an accident.
Couldn't someone drive you?

Well, this heart thing has really affected what I eat. I've had to cut out salt or what they call sodium. That's been really hard. I like cheese, salami, lox, bacon and all that yummy stuff. It seems that sodium is lurking everywhere .
Which foods do you enjoy unsalted?

I used to walk to the park with my nephews, but now I avoid walking more than a block because of the cramping in my right calf. I miss spending time with them. But I'm worried that the pain will make my leg worse. Is that true?
Have you been doing the stretches I gave you?

My brother, also a smoker, has undergone an amputation and I am concerned about losing my right foot/leg. Other than the risk for amputation, I know very little about poor leg circulation and I am concerned that my lack of knowledge will hurt me. I have never heard about walking as a way to help my PAD. I really don't want to lose my leg.
How many miles a day do you currently walk?

I'm overwhelmed trying to understand how to manage my poor leg circulation along with my diabetes, smoking, and hypertension. Smoking relaxes me and helps me cope with my stress. I also keep my grandchildren four days each week that is exhausting. I feel isolated because it is difficult to leave my home due to the cramping; the distance I can walk is decreasing. I really want to get out of my home and spend time with my grandchildren.
Why are you watching your grandchildren?

Initially, I thought that my PAD wasn't that bad. Asymptomatic as they call it; however, I realized I had begun to reduce my walking speed to prevent pain, so I guess it is worse than I thought. Limiting my mobility and keeping my disease to myself has been a stress on me and my family. I want to tell my family. I think that with the support of my family I can begin walking.
What will you ask your family to help you with?

I'm angry about having this PAD. I don't know where it came from. I want to walk, but can't push through the pain. I have tried a walking club at my church, but everyone walks a lot farther and the pain was just too much to bear. I'm looking for information and direction about how to start.
Can you find someone who wants to walk more frequently but less distance?

I ‚Äòm feeling discouraged but I know that I have to do something because I cannot walk one block without cramping in my calf. I have classic claudication where the cramping always comes on at the same distance. I don't drive and have always relied on my son to take me to the store, but I feel like I'm inconveniencing him too much. I would like to be able to walk two blocks to the bus stop. I don't understand how a walking program can be helpful, but one of my doctors mentioned walking as a way to treat this poor circulation. I may be willing to give it a try.
Could you join the walk group that meets tomorrow at 10:00?
I hate exercising, but I don't t want this PAD to get worse. I don't want to lose my legs. I used to walk a bit a while back but I was a lot younger back then.
Can you walk on your own or do you need a group to hold you accountable?
Walking down that long hallway is hard. I'm scared of falling and not being able to get up and make it to the bedroom. I feel like a prisoner in my own house.
Is there a way to switch bedrooms to be closer to the door?
My legs are heavy and numb. I'm worried I'll slip and fall walking on the icy sidewalks and driveways in Wichita. I really need to get back in shape.
Are you going to get a personal trainer?

A close friend of mine just died of a heart attack while walking in the grocery store. She was a heavy smoker and overweight. I want to quit but don't know how. I want to lose weight. I want to strengthen my lungs but I heard with PAD you cannot walk.
Do you want to join a therapy group to reduce smoking?
I need to exercise more but I'm worried that if I start to exercise it will bring on those hypoglycemic episodes.
Would rather hypoglycemic episodes or an amputation?
In our culture breast milk isn't enough to feed the baby, she won't sleep unless I give her supplements and some real food.

I pump it and throw it out, my mom told me because I had sore nipples that my milk wasn't any good.
Do you want a referral to a lactation consultant to help with your soreness?
If I sign up to be an organ donor and I'm in a life-threatening situation, doctors won't give me the best care. They won't try as hard to save my life.
Do you know how many people could be saved by one person's death if most organs can be used?
I know it's probably the right thing to do but I'm just not sure I am comfortable with the idea of someone cutting me up after I pass.
You know people have clothing on for their funeral and showing, right?
I've thought about it but don't know if it's for me. I guess God would want you to help out someone in need, but it's not exactly mentioned in the bible that we should do it.

You know how they treat us. They are just going to give our organs to some rich white folks. You can't trust the medical system. Look at what they did down at Tuskegee.

Everyone I know smokes pot, I don't even smoke as much as my friends.

This is total bulls@#t. I might get kicked off the football team because I got caught with a friggin' dime bag of weed. I could lose my scholarship. Everyone smokes and I just got unlucky getting caught.

I have had thoughts of offing myself, but I keep it to myself. I don't want anyone thinkin I'm crazy.

I am so angry about this whole f***cking mess. I never signed up thinking I'd have two tours let alone one. I knew it was a possibility, but I never thought it would turn out this way that I would have to be away for so long, be away from my family, my job, for what?

No matter how much people say they understand. They don't, they have no goddamn idea what is like there, it was hell and they don't really want to hear it, so I don't tell them.

They tell us that we have to be loyal to them you know, Corp, God, Country‚Ä¶blah blah‚Ä¶but where is the loyalty to us? They won't pay for my college, I have to drive two hours to get medical care, they promise us a lot but they don't deliver.

It sucks that we are never allowed to question the war publically. I'm not sure it was the right thing, I'm not sure they are better off, not sure we are better off, but if you question it, you are unpatriotic, you are some liberal navel gazer, you are a traitor.

I know I have to lose weight. I miss feeling comfortable in my skin. I hate how my clothes feel. I miss not feeling like a slug. I know my blood sugar is ‚Äúpre‚Äù blah blah. But with losing my job and my husband getting sick I don't know if I can deal anything else now, maybe in a few months.

I used to run with my girlfriends back in DC every morning. We would stop for coffee afterwards and hang out. It was great. But that seems like a lifetime ago. Since moving to Boston though I don't know anyone to run with.

I know we would all be better off if we were more active, but we are so busy and so tired all the time. We did have a great time when we went camping last summer but I'm not sure we can pull that off again.

I just love sweets. Cookies, candy, ice cream, you name it. And I know it is making me fat. I actually like fruit but my mom never buys any. She says they are really expensive and nobody eats them.

I'll probably drink less when I am older but for now I am going to party.

I know oxy ain't good for me, but it is the only thing that makes me feel happy. It ain't like I am shooting heroin.
